content: Career General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 19 Jul 2018I am an engineering student (with a set career) currently and I am taking lots of different courses (that interests me), ranging from massaging services to programming, photography to digital design. What other courses do you recommend me to take?3 answersAnswerBump1

ProdigyAnswered on 19 Jul 2018I would recommend the following:​Life skill: Save your love ones!SwimmingLife saving skillsCPR + AEDhttp://www.lifeguard.sg/courses/lifesaving-123-award/​Social skill: Improve relationshipCommunications skillshttps://www.udemy.com/elite-communication-skills-to-get-what-you-want-with-words/​Personal finance: Nobody Cares More About Your Money Than You DoInvestment courseshttps://blog.seedly.sg/singaporean-investment-courses/​Adventure: What is life without fun?Sky-divingsuba-divingPara-glidingWake-boardingMoutain climbingMost importantly, you must enjoy it!​0 comments2
Isabella JoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 21 Jul 2018I recommend taking language courses if you have the interest. It might be useful in your career and for your personal travel. 0 comments1

Steph YeoLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 19 Jul 2018If you're alr taking many courses that interest you, how do we effectively recommend more courses for you ah idk. Revisit your intention: What do you want to achieve w going for so many courses? Also, evaluate effectiveness: Are you applying anything from the courses you've taken?I find short term courses good for a touch and go introduction of main concepts but not so helpful for indepth mastery of the topic. Anything you've taken that has interested you enough to perhaps do further studies? Or make a difference in the society e.g. providing massages for the elderly or taking photos for charities?But i guess it could help to learn sth usually out of your comfort zone/interest, you could find a new love!0 comments0
